kvhc.util

Class SoundManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • kvhc.util.SoundManager

  • public class SoundManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The SoundManager class is used to manage and play sounds. Code based on blog entry by Martin Breuer: http://www.droidnova.com/creating-sound-effects-in-android-part-1,570.html
    Author:
    Martin Breuer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      SoundManager()

      Add a sound to a SoundManager.

      Initiate a SoundManager.

      • SoundManager

    • Method Detail

      • initSounds

        public void initSounds(Context context)
        Initiate a SoundManager.
        Parameters:
        context - Context for the audio service.

      • addSound

        public void addSound(int index,
            int soundID)
        Add a sound to a SoundManager.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the sound added.
        soundID - resource ID.

      • playSound

        public void playSound(int index,
             float right,
             float left,
             float volume)
        Play a sound. All volume values are floats between 0 and 1. Volume for right/left speaker are multiplied by the "global" volume.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the sound to play
        right - right volume
        left - left volume
        volume - "global" volume
